intro: Stylidium cygnorum, commonly known as the Swan River Daisy, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. The plant belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes other ornamental and sometimes toxic plants. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a bluish-gray hue. Stylidium cygnorum is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
